Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நல்லினத்தி னூங்குந் துணையில்லை தீயினத்தின் அல்லற் படுப்பதூஉம் இல்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: There is no greater help than the company of the good; there is no greater source of sorrow than the company of the wicked.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A dramatic split composition. On the left side, a person is climbing a difficult mountain. They are being helped and pulled up by a group of strong, supportive, good companions ('நல்லினம்'). This is the greatest support ('துணை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right side, a person is being dragged down into a dark, thorny abyss by a group of shadowy, wicked companions ('தீயினம்'). This is the greatest source of sorrow ('அல்லல்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The sky on the left is bright and hopeful. The sky on the right is dark, stormy, and full of despair.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A powerful visual dichotomy illustrating that good company is the greatest support, and bad company is the greatest cause of suffering.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The upward climb represents progress and support. The downward pull into the abyss represents ruin and sorrow. The contrast between the companions—supportive vs. destructive—is the core of the image.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Starkly contrasting, supportive vs. destructive, hopeful vs. tragic.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Left side: Bright, hopeful, warm colors. Right side: Dark, despairing, cold colors with deep shadows.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A symmetrical wide shot that presents the two scenarios as two sides of the same coin.

Cultural_Anchors: Good Company as the Greatest Support ('நல்லினம்... துணை')
